reviews.review_msg: Great prof, but I did not expect the emphasis on participation. That said, I will retake her class :)

Such a fun professor, gives amazing lectures and the textbook lines up perfectly with her lecture schedule. Definitely would suggest going to class because she goes over practice questions for exams. She gives really good feedback on papers and lets you submit them before they're due for comments which was so helpful

Best prof at SFU and a really interesting course. She'll work so hard to help you if you're willing to put the work in. You will have to study a lot (know specific details and examples for exams) and the final paper is so long, but if you work hard and ask for help you'll get an A no problem. Such a nice person and her lectures are really fun.

She's a really great proff and an engaging lecturer. Her passion for the subject matter really shines through and you can tell she genuinely cares about her students. She is very accessible and willing to help! you definitely need to attend lectures, but honestly, I looked forward to her lectures!

I haven't yet finished the semester with Sabrina, however she is single handedly one of the greatest profs I've had at SFU. She's so insanely engaging, and so passionate about the topics she teaches; you can't help but pay attention. One of the kindest people I've ever met, she wants students to succeed (start your term paper as early as you can!)
